document_metadata.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: Consistent with this finding, we confirmed that while p300 overexpression induced ac-tau, SIRT1 deacetylated tau in HEK293 cells using pan-ac-tau antibody Ab708 (Fig. 1A).

citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: Using the SILAC method, we identified five lysines acetylated by p300 expression (i.e., K163, K174, K274, K280, and K369; Fig. 1B). All five lysines were deacetylated by SIRT1 expression (Fig. 1B).

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: Levels of human ac-K174 tau detected with AC312 antibody were significantly elevated by loss of SIRT1 (t(11)    4.69, p 0.0007, unpaired t test), whereas levels of ac-K274 tau remained unaffected (Fig. 2A,B).

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: We showed that AAV-SIRT1-induced hippocampal SIRT1 overexpression in tauP301S mice significantly lowered the levels of ac-K174 in the mossy fiber of the left hippocampus, compared with the AAVGFP- injected controls (t(21)    2.5, p 0.0231, unpaired t test; Fig. 5C,D).

citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: Levels of human ac-K174 tau detected with AC312 antibody were significantly elevated by loss of SIRT1 (t(11)    4.69, p 0.0007, unpaired t test), whereas levels of ac-K274 tau remained unaffected (Fig. 2A,B).

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: SIRT1 deletion accelerated premature mortality in tauP301S mice (p 0.0329, log rank; Fig. 3A).

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: No significant synaptophysin loss was detected in tauP301S mice or in mice lacking SIRT1 alone in the frontal cortex and hippocampus (Fig. 3B,C).

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: However, brain-specific SIRT1 deletion in tauP301S mice resulted in a significant loss of synaptophysin in the frontal cortex [F(3,19) 7.5, p    0.0079 (tauP301S; SIRT1 F/F vs Nestin-Cre; tauP301S; SIRT1 F/F), ANOVA] and hippocampus [F(3,19)        11.83, p 0.0019 (tauP301S; SIRT1 F/F vs Nestin-Cre; tauP301S; SIRT1 F/F), ANOVA], indicating that SIRT1 deficiency exacerbated tau-mediated synaptic deficits (Fig. 3B,C).

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: Interestingly, deletion of SIRT1 did not affect the number of neurofibrillary tangles significantly, as measured with Gallyas silver staining (Fig. 3D).

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: We next assessed the effects of SIRT1 deficiency on tau mediated behavioral deficits. In the EPM test, tauP301S mice deficient in SIRT1, compared with tauP301S mice without the deficiency, spent significantly more time in the open arm [F(3,50) 15.05, p     0.0001 (tauP301S; SIRT1 F/F vs Nestin-Cre; tauP301S; SIRT1 F/F, ANOVA], suggesting that SIRT1 deletion in tauP301S mice exacerbates behavioral disinhibition (Fig. 4A).

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: Notably, SIRT1 overexpression significantly reduced the spread of MC1-positive tau pathology to the contralateral hippocampus, compared with the group injected with AAV-GFP (p 0.001, multilevel mixed effects model; Fig. 5E,F).

citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: No significant synaptophysin loss was detected in tauP301S mice or in mice lacking SIRT1 alone in the frontal cortex and hippocampus (Fig. 3B,C).

links.evidence: SIRT1 deletion led to a significant increase of human ac- K174 tau in the PSD-enriched fractions (t(11)          2.47, p         0.0312, unpaired t test; Fig. 2C,D).

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: Interestingly, levels of total human tau in the PSD-enriched fraction were also significantly increased by SIRT1 deletion (t(11)        2.77, p 0.0183, unpaired t test; Fig. 2C,D).

citation.journal: The Journal of neuroscience : the official journal of the Society for Neuroscience
citation.name: SIRT1 Deacetylates Tau and Reduces Pathogenic Tau Spread in a Mouse Model of Tauopathy.

links.evidence: Regardless of human tauP301S expression, SIRT1 deletion led to significantly impaired learning for locating a hidden platform [p +/- 0.001 (SIRT1 F/F vs Nestin-Cre; SIRT1 F/F); p       0.011 (SIRT1 F/F vs Nestin-Cre; tauP301S; SIRT1 F/F), multilevel mixed effects model; Fig. 4C] and reduced memory retention measured by number of platform crossings (Fig. 4D).

links.evidence: Regardless of human tauP301S expression, SIRT1 deletion led to significantly impaired learning for locating a hidden platform [p +/- 0.001 (SIRT1 F/F vs Nestin-Cre; SIRT1 F/F); p       0.011 (SIRT1 F/F vs Nestin-Cre; tauP301S; SIRT1 F/F), multilevel mixed effects model; Fig. 4C] and reduced memory retention measured by number of platform crossings (Fig. 4D).

links.evidence: Injection of tau fibrils into the hippocampus of 2-month-old tauP301S mice resulted in a marked increase of MC1-positive tau pathology in the ipsilateral and contralateral hippocampus of tau fibril injection within 1 month (Fig. 5E).
